full_summary:
**Tender Announcement for SJAM Projector Niches**
=====================================================

**Reference:** PW-PPS-028-28805

**Document Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)

**Project Title:** EP757-221971/A - SJAM Projector Niches

**Summary:**
We are inviting interested suppliers to submit a proposal for the construction of new projector niches at the 144 Wellington Street, Ottawa, Ontario location, of the SJAM building. The project involves the modification of six existing AV projector niches to accommodate larger projectors and includes HVAC and structural enhancements.

**Key Project Details:**

*   **Dates:**
    *   Tender Closing Date: 2022-09-29T14:00:00
    *   Expected Contract Start Date: 2022-10-18 (17 weeks after contract award)
*   **Site Visit:** There will be an optional site visit on 2022-09-22 at 9:00 AM. Interested bidders must contact Mike Stirling at mike.stirling@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca by 2022-09-20 at 3:00 PM to arrange their visit.
*   **Bid Documents:** Bid documents are available through the Government Electronic Tendering Service at [http://Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders](http://Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders).
*   **Bid Submission:** Bids must be submitted electronically through the CPC Connect service provided by Canada Post Corporation.

**Security Requirements:**
As this project involves access to a secure site, the successful bidder must ensure that their personnel possess required security clearances and compliance with the attached security checklist and guidelines.

**Questions and Inquiries:**
If you have any questions regarding this tender, please direct your inquiries to Mike Stirling at mike.stirling@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

**Trade Agreements:**
This project is subject to the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Language:**
Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

Do not hesitate to reach out to the above-specified contact if you have any questions or concerns. Make sure to check links mentioned above for correct/currect attachments. It is always good to verify dates before submitting a quote. 

Best of luck with your tender response.  You will be analyzing this project document as part of a global analysis for government Tenders, Sourcing, and nuclualization
